qas.question: What was Eton's beagle club accused of in January 2016?
What evidence was brought forth of a potential hare hunt?
Did Eton's official statement say that they took the matter seriously or frivilously?
In what year did Eaton establish the beagling club?
In what year was the League Against Cruel Sports founded?
When was hunting hare's made illegal in the UK?
What is the best month to hunt hares in the UK?
Who taped the Eton Beagles illegally hunting a hare?

context: In <b6_0>January<b6_0/> <b3_0><b4_0><b5_0>2016<b5_0/><b4_0/><b3_0/>, the Eton College beagling club was accused by the <b7_0>League Against Cruel Sports<b7_0/> of undertaking <a0_0>an illegal hare hunt<a0_0/>. The allegations were accompanied by <a1_0>a video<a1_0/> of the Eton Beagles chasing a hare, as 'the hunt staff urge the beagles on and make no efforts to call the dogs off.' A spokesman representing Eton College released the following statement: "Eton College takes its legal responsibilities <a2_0>extremely seriously<a2_0/> and expects all school activities to comply with the law. We are investigating this allegation as a matter of urgency and will be co-operating fully with the relevant authorities."
